messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] The "Book of Firearms", Nagasawa Shagetzuma.
messages.msgSnippet: Is the author s name by chance acrtulayy  SHIGEO SUGAWA????    If so, then I have it.  It is well worth having for anyone interested in
messages.messageBody:
Is the author's name by chance acrtulayy SHIGEO SUGAWA???? If so, then I
have it. It is well worth having for anyone interested in
teppo/tanegashima/hinawaju as it is in English. Many excellent colour
photos and a very interesting section on accoutrements.

Barry Thomas.

PS: I have just received from a friend a copy of a Japanese book on
firearms. Very comprehensive, some remarkable photos, many gunsmith mei.
Anyone interested in the details please mail me off line. I've been trying
to compile a list of my (small) firearm references for those interested so
anyone interested in that please also email me off line.

----- Original Message -----
From: wayne docimo <kellylindawd@...>
To: <samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, October 19, 2004 2:06 PM
Subject: [samuraihistory] The "Book of Firearms", Nagasawa Shagetzuma.

here is a book i have come across being mentioned several times
The "Book of Firearms", Nagasawa Shagetzuma.
does anybody know anything about it


thank you

wayne
